author: kfogel
msg: Handle eol and keyword untranslation in one place.
NOTE: This commit breaks diff_tests.py tests 5 and 6, but Ben needs to
start using the new interface, so will fix afterwards.
* subversion/include/svn_wc.h, subversion/libsvn_wc/util.c
(svn_wc_translated_file): New function.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/questions.c (svn_wc__files_contents_same_p): If
the contents are not identical, set *same to 0.  Unbelievable as it
may seem, this bug has been here since the day this function was
written.  The caller just happened to compensate by starting with the
assumption that the files were not the same.  Today I rewrote the
caller, and the regression tests caught the bug, bless 'em.
(svn_wc__versioned_file_modcheck): Just use svn_wc_translated_file.
(svn_wc_text_modified_p): Comment tweak.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/wc.h (svn_wc__versioned_file_modcheck):
Document error case better.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/diff.c (file_diff, close_file): Just use
svn_wc_translated_file.
* subversion/include/svn_io.h (svn_io_remove_file): New prototype.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/io.c (svn_io_remove_file): New function,
wrapper around apr_file_remove.
Unrelated fix:
* subversion/libsvn_wc/props.c (svn_wc__get_keywords): Compare
characters against '\0', not NULL.  Ben's compiler didn't print
warnings for these!  Mine does, though.  They're both GCC 2.95blah,
mine under Linux, his under FreeBSD.  Go figure.

author: sussman
msg: Add keyword logic to existing EOL logic for 'svn revert'.
* adm_ops.c (revert_admin_things): When copying the text-base out to
the working copy, make sure to do any eol translations or keyword
substitutions, as dictated by the property values.  This is the same
logic done by checkout/update, but without any tricky snafus to
beware.  :-)

author: sussman
msg: Add keyword logic to existing EOL logic for 'svn ci'.
* adm_crawler.c (do_postfix_text_deltas): check the keyword property
when preparing to commit a file.  Always send a 'contract' flag to
svn_io_copy_and_translate when creating the tmpfile that will be
committed. Also, I think the styles got mixed up in the if..else
cases, so I fixed them.
* log.c (replace_text_base): always copy_and_translate the committed
tmpfile back on top of working after the commit succeeds.  See the
comment for details.

author: gstein
msg: Change the name of the "is_status" flag to "fetch_content" to describe
its desired semantic. This is clearer than a "mode" flag.
* fetch.c (report_baton_t {}): rename is_status field to fetch_content
(start_element): test fetch_content rather than is_status. flip the
condition since the new field is inverted from before. also, pass
the new field to simple_fetch_file()
(add_node_props): test fetch_content. flip the condition.
(end_element): use the new fetch_content field rather than is_status
(make_reporter): take and set fetch_content rather than is_status
(svn_ra_dav__do_update): flip value passed to make_reporter()
(svn_ra_dav__do_status): flip value passed to make_reporter()

author: gstein
msg: Use the new error conversion function that Joe implemented a while back.
[ all files in libsvn_ra_dav ]
* props.c (svn_ra_dav__get_props): use svn_ra_dav__convert_error
* commit.c (checkout_resource, do_proppatch, commit_add_dir, commit_add_file,
commit_stream_close, apply_log_message): ditto
* fetch.c (simple_fetch_file, svn_ra_dav__get_file): ditto
